column4: I have some problem with mozilla i have to force quit it to make it shutdown
how often do you get that?
ok how much RAM?
ok maybe you got a bad profile
,but I have had my own problems with  Ubuntu's unoffical  Firefox version
yes there's some Ubuntu changes
it's not an offical Mozilla Linux Firefox
you tried to install a offical Linux MOzilla Firefox?
from Mozilla
ok well  other good browsers for Ubuntu to :d
I would normalley say to people to use Firefox or Opera, so  they  gain  more market share :d
,but if you got problems
well yeah there's Opera, that's  closed source though
quite a nice browser though
,but  Konqueror is my browser of choice after FIrefox
then there's  Epiphany and Galeon which are nice to,  and use the Gecko rendering engine so display the pages the same as FIrefox,  where as Konq uses KTHML
sudo apt-get install  epiphany-browser  if you did just  epiphany you would get some game.   sudo apt-get install galeon  also  :d
sudo apt-get install konqueror
konqueror is  a KDE app
I think the Firefox issues in Ubuntu, most of them, are an Ubuntu issue
I got a feeling that FIrefox works better in other distros,  but  they use a more offical or an offical version also
Ubuntu and KUbuntu well
you can have both installed.  then run KDE and Gnome apps
Kubuntu/KDE apps run in Ubuntu/Gnome.   just like    Ubuntu/Gnome apps run in Kubuntu/KDE
